casebody.data:
Florence H. CHANCE and Provident Trust Company of Philadelphia, Executors of the Estate of Thomas M. Chance, Deceased, and Marcus A. Walker, Maude Staples and Scranton Lackawanna Trust Company, Executors of the Estate of Harry O. Staples, Deceased, Plaintiffs-Appellants, v. LEHIGH NAVIGATION COAL COMPANY, Defendant-Appellee. No. 6969. Circuit Court of Appeals, Third Circuit. Dec. 8, 1939. Paul & Paul, of Philadelphia, Pa. (Merrell E. Clark, of New York City, Hugh M. Morris, of Wilmington, Del., Henry N. Paul, Jr., of Philadelphia, Pa., and William J. Barnes, of New York City, of counsel), for plaintiffs-appellants. Howson & Howson, of Philadelphia, Pa. (Charles H. Howson, Dexter N. Shaw, Samuel D. Matlack, and Wm. J. Turner, all of Philadelphia, Pa., of counsel), for defendant-appellee.

Before BIGGS, MARIS, and BIDDLE, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

The decree of the district court is affirmed upon the opinion of Judge Kirkpatrick, 25 F.Supp. 532.
